steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3hhg5","text":"Prior to initiating the protocol, ensure that all active workbenches are cleaned with 80% ethanol, all relevant personal protective clothing is worn and the work area is prepared according to local GLP guidelines for molecular methods.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hl4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b78fp","text":"Create an organised bench space by clearing away all clutter in order to maximize work efficiency and to avoid unnecessary movements that will minimise exposure of sterile materials to airborne and liquid contaminants. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au2kt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"859uq","text":"Prepare a large bucket of ice to store reagents and samples temporarily during use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting Up a Run on the MiSeq

","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3r4g8","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":102,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5bliv","text":"Do not add ethanol directly to the flow cell, and avoid getting ethanol (or wipes) on the port gasket.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"AC59073B344B11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":270,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"c57v0\",\"text\":\"Figure 5.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2021-01-04 at 16.08.13.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/cugqbf8zp.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/cugqbf8zp.png","width":252}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i6ud","text":"Dry excess alcohol with a lint-free lens cleaning tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sajm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l9ga","text":"Make sure that the flow cell ports are free of obstructions and that the gasket is well-seated around the flow cell ports.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fsnv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am0am","text":"If the gasket appears to be dislodged, gently press it back into place until it sits securely around the flow cell ports.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Carefully wipe the surface of the flow cell stage until it is clean and dry.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"fgode","text":"Biosafety warning: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6srib","text":"This document describes handling of DNA and associated products, and does not describe best practices for handling of biological infectious material. Handling biological material should be carried out in accordance with local health and safety standards. Handling and discarding used reagents such as chemical waste should be in accordance with applicable regional, national, and local laws and regulations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o74e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3udhj","text":"Chemical Safety Warning: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqgv0","text":"The MiSeq Reagent Cartridges contain formamide (GHS classification Category 1B for reproductive toxicity), an aliphatic amide that is a potential reproductive toxin. Personal injury can occur through inhalation, ingestions, skin and eye contact. See the Illumina kit SDS for additional information and take proper precautions when handling the cartridges and MiSeq waste. Ensure spent containers and unused contents are disposed of in accordance with local governmental safety standards. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpmoq","text":"Ethanol is flammable (GHS Flammability Category 2); take precautions when handling, storing and disposing of ethanol in the laboratory. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmi5i","text":"Sodium hydroxide is corrosive (GHS Category 1A and 1, GHS Category 3 for acute hazards to aquatic environment); take precautions when handling, storing and disposing of sodium hydroxide in the laboratory.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"addu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh9a6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oiog","text":"Waste generated from a sequencing run on the MiSeq contains potentially hazardous chemicals. Personal injury can occur through inhalation, ingestion, skin contact, and eye contact. Wear protective equipment, including eye protection, gloves, and laboratory coat appropriate for risk of exposure. For additional environmental, health, and safety information, see the SDS at support.illumina.com/sds.html.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
